A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: After seeing it and trying desperately hard to like it\, after 24 hours of thinking it through the film is very disappointing. Twists are thrown in every 2 seconds and feel pointless - trying too hard. Too much going on\, unnecessary casino CGI action scene that felt more like it belonged to the awful prequels\, but most unforgivably is having Luke become a character you couldn't like anymore. All the hard work done in Force Awakens has been undone here. JJ got it spot on with Episode 7\, but this director didn't have a clue what Star Wars is really all about. How the critics are fawning over this beats me. I reckon once the dust has settled they will all reach the same conclusion as the viewing public. This is a poor film that has taken the franchise back to the dark ages of the prequels again.
